intro: Kirganelia elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic kirganelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
